intro: Sphaeralcea marginata, commonly known as the narrowleaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Sphaeralcea marginata is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
